variations.description:
variations
Iris Objects are scaled and cached to speed up placements. Because of this extra memory is used, so we evenly distribute variations across the defined scale range, then pick one randomly. If the differences is small, use a lower number. For more possibilities on the scale spectrum, increase this at the cost of memory.

Integer
* Default Value is 7
* Minimum allowed is 1
* Maximum allowed is 32
variations.x-intellij-html-description:
variations
Iris Objects are scaled and cached to speed up placements. Because of this extra memory is used, so we evenly distribute variations across the defined scale range, then pick one randomly. If the differences is small, use a lower number. For more possibilities on the scale spectrum, increase this at the cost of memory.

Integer
* Default Value is 7
* Minimum allowed is 1
* Maximum allowed is 32

minimumScale.description:
minimumScale
The minimum scale

Number
* Default Value is 1.0
* Minimum allowed is 0.01
* Maximum allowed is 50.0
minimumScale.x-intellij-html-description:
minimumScale
The minimum scale

Number
* Default Value is 1.0
* Minimum allowed is 0.01
* Maximum allowed is 50.0

maximumScale.description:
maximumScale
The maximum height for placement (top of object)

Number
* Default Value is 1.0
* Minimum allowed is 0.01
* Maximum allowed is 50.0
maximumScale.x-intellij-html-description:
maximumScale
The maximum height for placement (top of object)

Number
* Default Value is 1.0
* Minimum allowed is 0.01
* Maximum allowed is 50.0

interpolation.description:
interpolation
If this object is scaled up beyond its origin size, specify a 3D interpolator

ObjectPlacementScaleInterpolator
Use 3D Interpolation on scaled objects if they are larger than the origin.
    
* Default Value is NONE
Must be a valid ObjectPlacementScaleInterpolator (use ctrl+space for auto complete!)
interpolation.x-intellij-html-description:
interpolation
If this object is scaled up beyond its origin size, specify a 3D interpolator

ObjectPlacementScaleInterpolator
Use 3D Interpolation on scaled objects if they are larger than the origin.

* Default Value is NONE
Must be a valid ObjectPlacementScaleInterpolator (use ctrl+space for auto complete!)

oneOf.description: Uses linear interpolation in 3 dimensions, generally pretty good, but slow
oneOf.x-intellij-html-description: Uses linear interpolation in 3 dimensions, generally pretty good, but slow

oneOf.description: Uses cubic spline interpolation in 3 dimensions, even better, but extreme slowdowns
oneOf.x-intellij-html-description: Uses cubic spline interpolation in 3 dimensions, even better, but extreme slowdowns

oneOf.description: Uses hermite spline interpolation in 3 dimensions, even better, but extreme slowdowns
oneOf.x-intellij-html-description: Uses hermite spline interpolation in 3 dimensions, even better, but extreme slowdowns
